utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Chandler's, Monica, Chandler, Ross, and Rachel are sitting around the table.]

utterances.transcript: I'm glad you're here, we have a couple of things to ask you about the wedding ceremony.

utterances.transcript: What's the matter? You okay?

utterances.transcript: Yeah, it's just y'know...

utterances.transcript: Uh, so anyway, we thought one of you could read something during the ceremony.

Do you think you could get through a poem?
It'll be a short one.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (crying) It'll be a short one.

Ohhh...
Okay. Yeah, I guess, I guess I could do that too.

utterances.transcript: Yeah, I kind of uh, have something else planned for you guys.

utterances.transcript: Hey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering, excited) Hey!

utterances.transcript: Hey!

utterances.transcript: Days Of Our Lives. Anyway, you're not gonna believe it! My character is coming out of his coma!!

utterances.transcript: Oh!!
That's great!
caption: that s wonderful

utterances.transcript: And-and-and not only that, I'm gettin' a new brain!!

utterances.transcript: So great things are happening at work and in your personal life!
caption: so great things are happening at work and in your personal life

utterances.transcript: Wait, what do you mean you're getting a new brain?
caption: what do you mean you re getting a new brain

utterances.transcript: Oh well, they're killing off one of the characters on the show, and when she dies her brain is being transplanted into my body.
caption: they re killing off one of the characters and when she dies and her brain is being transplanted into my body

utterances.transcript: What? A brain transplant?!
caption: heh what a brain transplant

utterances.transcript: Yes, it's a highly controversial procedure.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (seriously) Yes, it's a highly controversial procedure.

utterances.transcript: It's ridiculous!
caption: it s ridiculous

utterances.transcript: Well, I think it's ridiculous that you haven't had sex in three and a half months.
caption: i think it s ridiculous that you haven t had sex in three and a half months

utterances.transcript: It's winter, they are fewer people on the street.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Monica and Rachel) It's winter, they are fewer people on the street. (Rachel and Monica smile and nod, knowingly.)

utterances.transcript: Who are they killing off?
caption: who are they killing off

utterances.transcript: Uh Cecilia Monroe, she plays Jessica Lockhart.

utterances.transcript: Noo!!

utterances.transcript: She's my favorite character on DOOL.
Nice.
She is so good at throwing drinks in people's faces, I mean I don't think I've ever seen her finish a beverage.

utterances.transcript: And the way she slaps all the time!
caption: the way she slaps people wouldn t you love to do that

utterances.transcript: Oh!
Wouldn't you love to do it just once?!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Wouldn't you love to do it just once?! (Raises her hand towards Chandler.)

utterances.transcript: Don't do it.
caption: don t do it

utterances.transcript: Cecilia Monroe man, what a great actress.
Oh, tell me about it. And she's been on the show forever, it's gonna be really hard to fill her shoes.

utterances.transcript: Yeah-yeah, help me out here, when you come out of the "brain transplant," you are going to be her?

plots: Ross says that Ross has a surprise for Monica and Chandler 's wedding , and when Monica and Chandler hear someone playing the bagpipes extremely badly across the street Monica and Chandler realize that Ross intends to play them at the wedding .

Monica and Chandler hear terrible noises outside Monica and Chandler 's apartment , which sounds like a cat dying ; however , Chandler remembers something Ross said and realizes the noise is Ross practicing playing the bagpipes .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Silvercup Studios, Dina is at the craft services table getting some food as Joey walks up.]

utterances.transcript: So you like the nachos uh? Myself I'm partial to...

utterances.transcript_with_note: (interrupting) I'm 16.

utterances.transcript: See you in 2003.
utterances.transcript_with_note: See you in 2003. (She walks away.)

utterances.transcript: You're absolutely right they are writing me out of the show. They don't know exactly when it's going to happen, but apparently going to be very soon and that's it.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (walking up) You're absolutely right they are writing me out of the show. They don't know exactly when it's going to happen, but apparently going to be very soon and that's it.

utterances.transcript: I'm so sorry. Look, if it was up to me you would never leave the show.

No I mean it! I can't believe they would do this to you! And to your fans! I mean they are going to be devastated! Heart broken! They love you so much!
Oh you're right. Thank you! What's your name again?
Joey.
Joey, well thank you. That is so sweet. Oh, excuse me.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Joey, well thank you. That is so sweet. Oh, excuse me. (She throws her drink on a passing writer.)

I'm having a conversation here! You were saying?

utterances.transcript: Uh yeah-ye-ye-ye-ye-ye-l-l-l-l-l-look the-the-the only reason that I, that I came up to you before was because well, I'm really nervous about-about being you. Y'know if you can help me capture the essence of the character. Y'know? Help me keep Jessica alive. Please?
All right Joey, I will help you. Not because I-I owe it to this stupid show, but because I owe it to Jessica.
Oh that's great! Oh thank you so much!
You're so welcome.
Hey! Now, I've been watching some tapes, how's this? "Jessica Lockhart will never step foot in this place again! Ever!!"

plots: Dina then agrees to help Joey because Dina owes it to Dina character , leading the two to eventually hook up .
Cecilia agrees to help , but not because of the show , but because of Jessica .

plots: While arranging the wedding , Monica and Chandler learn that Ross has a surprise in store : He 's planning to play the bagpipes .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Silvercup Studios, Joey is getting pointers on how to play Jessica Lockhart.]

utterances.transcript: So, the essence of the character is rooted in her confidence. So, when Jessica enters a room for instance, she owns everything and every person in that room. You try.
utterances.transcript_with_note: So, the essence of the character is rooted in her confidence. So, when Jessica enters a room for instance, she owns everything and every person in that room. (Joey is nodding.) You try.

utterances.transcript: Okay! All right!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay! (He scurries out the set door and re-enters, extremely impressed) All right!

utterances.transcript: No, he already knows that he owns everything in the room! He's not finding it out for the first time! So, try it again.
Okay. Okay.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay. Okay. (He goes out and comes back in, glaring at everything.)

utterances.transcript: Right. He's not angry at the room either. Try it again, he owns it! He owns the room. It is his. He owns, owns, owns, owns the room! He owns it!! All right, it's a little weird, but it's getting better. Oh well, I'm gonna miss this woman so much. I don't know what I'm going to do! I mean, it's been 20 years of my life.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Right. He's not angry at the room either. Try it again, he owns it! He owns the room. It is his. He owns, owns, owns, owns the room! He owns it!! (Joey gets a snooty look on his face.) All right, it's a little weird, but it's getting better. (Joey is pleased.) Oh well, I'm gonna miss this woman so much. I don't know what I'm going to do! I mean, it's been 20 years of my life.

utterances.transcript: Oh well-Hey-hey! Maybe, maybe uh, maybe this is a good thing. Y'know? It'll-it'll give you a chance to shake things up, play different characters. You're so talented.
I am. I am, but I don't know you know. An actor of a certain age is not that easy.
Hey that's not true! Look at uh, look at Angela Lansb-Angelina Jolie!
I probably should've just left years ago when the offers were pouring in, but y'know I just got so comfy here! And... Ohh, I turned down some amazing work!
Like-like what?
Well, let's just say if I left 15 years ago, the landscape of Mexican cinema would be very different today!
Wow!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (impressed) Wow!

utterances.transcript: But... Well now, now's a different time for me.
utterances.transcript_with_note: But... Well now, now's a different time for me. (Starts to cry.)

utterances.transcript: Oh hey come on, don't-don't-don't do this! Umm, look let-let me tell you something, okay? Now when I watch you do a scene, I'm thinking, "Boy, she-she is a great actress!" Uh but-but, I am also thinking, "She is hot!"
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh hey come on, don't-don't-don't do this! Umm, look let-let me tell you something, okay? Now when I watch you do a scene, I'm thinking, "Boy, she-she is a great actress!" (She's not buying it.) Uh but-but, I am also thinking, "She is hot!"

utterances.transcript: You think I'm hot?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (intrigued) You think I'm hot?

utterances.transcript: You own the room. We should probably get-get uh...
utterances.transcript_with_note: You own the room. (She smiles and stares longingly into his eyes.) We should probably get-get uh...

utterances.transcript: Oh yeah-yeah, we should get the... So when Jessica kisses a man, she usually puts umm, both her hands on the man's face.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh yeah-yeah, we should get the... (Pause) So when Jessica kisses a man, she usually puts umm, both her hands on the man's face. (She does so.)

utterances.transcript: Yeah-yeah, I noticed that! Is that 'cause she's so passionate?
No! It's because that way the camera only sees her! Do you wanna try it?
utterances.transcript_with_note: No! It's because that way the camera only sees her! (She takes her hands off his face.) Do you wanna try it?

utterances.transcript: Yeah! Okay.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah! Okay. (He puts his hands on her face and they kiss.)

utterances.transcript: That was good, that was really good. But I-I think your hands maybe a little off, they should be maybe right like...
utterances.transcript_with_note: That was good, that was really good. But I-I think your hands maybe a little off, they should be maybe right like... (She grabs the back of his neck and kisses him passionately causing them to fall onto the couch.)

plots: When Joey consults the woman ( Susan Sarandon ) about how to best play Cecilia 's character once Joey is supposed to " become " Cecilia , Cecilia did not know Cecilia was being killed off and flips out .
Cecilia is trying to teach a man to take over a role , and she ends up seducing this man .

utterances.transcript_with_note: (He starts. So of course, for a beginner like Ross, it sounds absolutely dreadful. The assembled audience minus Phoebe, are horrified. Phoebe, immune to bad music, seems to enjoy it.)

utterances.transcript: You know the song! Sing along!

utterances.transcript: So?
No!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Ross throws the bagpipes down in disgust.)
